properties.value: The Standing Stones are mysterious stones found north of Falador. Their current purpose is unknown, however, Mod West reportedly planned to utilise them in the Warding skill, provided it would pass a poll, which it didn't.[1] An easy treasure trail clue describes the two central stones as "ominous stones in Falador". There is also a Standing Stone located south of the Settlement Ruins west of Wintertodt.

The Standing Stones are mysterious stones found north of Falador. Their current purpose is unknown, however, Mod West reportedly planned to utilise them in the Warding skill, provided it would pass a poll, which it didn't.[1] An easy treasure trail clue describes the two central stones as "ominous stones in Falador". There is also a Standing Stone located south of the Settlement Ruins west of Wintertodt.

At RuneFest 2010 it was revealed that they were added because the graphics designer was told to make some existing stones look "interesting".

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 17 June 2019. (Archived from the original on 17 June 2019.) Mod Ash: "I'd expect the lore to be applicable here too, tbh. Though Mod West did propose some Warding-specific lore for them, if that skill were to pass a poll."

The '''Standing Stones''' are mysterious stones found north of [[Falador]]. Their current purpose is unknown, however, [[Jagex Moderator|Mod West]] reportedly planned to utilise them in the [[Warding]] skill, provided it would pass a poll, which [[Poll:Warding Skill|it didn't]].{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1140717039364870144|date=17 June 2019|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20190617204755/https:/twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1140717039364870144|archivedate=17 June 2019|quote=I'd expect the lore to be applicable here too, tbh. Though Mod West did propose some Warding-specific lore for them, if that skill were to pass a poll.}} An [[easy treasure trail]] clue describes the two central stones as "ominous stones in Falador". There is also a Standing Stone located south of the Settlement Ruins west of Wintertodt.

At {{RSL|RuneFest 2010}} it was revealed that they were added because the graphics designer was told to make some existing stones look "interesting".
